title: FT: The rarest of T206 backs
author: scottglevy

posts.post_title: FT: The rarest of T206 backs
posts.post_content:
Let’s see what folks are willing to part with.  

On offer is a PSA1 Jordan BROWN Lenox and a PSA “A” (trimmed edge) - T206 Murphy Drum.  

Hit me up with trade ideas…would consider T206 Greem Cobb in mid grade, 1933 Goudey Ruth, Mays/Mantle/Robinson Rookies… impress me :)

[url]Scottglevy@yahoo.com[/url]

I’ve got a 1988 Topps Bill Buckner!!

You should see this guy’s hair due. You almost miss the mustache

2 for 1?
Jk Scott, sweet cards! Good Luck

Scans Please!!:D

Hope you are great my friend!!!!!
I can never figure out how to get any images posted here.  But if you would like I’ll email you scans

Just in case you want to give it a shot - I know getting images to post has been a recurring question for a long time here :

Posting Images to Net54 Boards:
  * Scanned image will need to be converted to .jpg – I use an old Google product called Picassa for that (there are others also)
  * I use a Free Flickr (flickr.com) account for creating online albums and then uploading scanned .jpg images to the cloud.
  * Once you have uploaded an image to Flickr you will need to :
  * Select the image in your Flickr Album.
  * Scroll Down to “Viewing Privacy” options and change from PRIVATE to PUBLIC.
  * Then scroll back up and click on “Share Photo” which will give you several options for sharing.
  * I typically use “BBCODE” and copy that link over to my Net 54 post and Submit.
  * Your Image(s) will now appear in your post.

There are several other ways (including upload to Net54) but this has always worked for me.
These are for Scott, here’s the first
